variant.name: .EveryReport
variant.summary: sent with every metrics report, and preferred for computing uniques

variant.name: de-DE
variant.summary: German language code

variant.name: en-US
variant.summary: English language code

variant.name: es-ES
variant.summary: Spanish language code

variant.name: fr-FR
variant.summary: French language code

variant.name: it-IT
variant.summary: Italian language code

variant.name: ja-JP
variant.summary: Japanese language code

variant.name: ActionRecorder
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Action Recorder

variant.name: Copy
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Copy

variant.name: Cut
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Cut

variant.name: Decrement
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Decrement

variant.name: Dictation
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Dictation

variant.name: DisplayBrightnessDown
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Display Brightness Down

variant.name: DisplayBrightnessUp
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Display Brightness Up

variant.name: DisplayMenu
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Display Menu

variant.name: DisplayMirror
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Display Mirror

variant.name: DisplayRotate
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Display Rotate

variant.name: DisplayZoomIn
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Display Zoom In

variant.name: DisplayZoomOut
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Display Zoom Out

variant.name: EndTextSelection
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: End Text Selection

variant.name: ExecuteMacro
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Execute Macro

variant.name: Increment
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Increment

variant.name: ItemScan
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Item Scan

variant.name: JumpToBeginningOfText
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Jump To Beginning Of Text

variant.name: JumpToEndOfText
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Jump To End Of Text

variant.name: Keyboard
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Keyboard

variant.name: LeaveGroup
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Leave Group

variant.name: LeftClick
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Left Click

variant.name: MediaFastforward
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Media Fastforward

variant.name: MediaMenu
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Media Menu

variant.name: MediaMute
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Media Mute

variant.name: MediaPlayPause
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Media Play Pause

variant.name: MediaRewind
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Media Rewind

variant.name: MediaVolumeDown
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Media Volume Down

variant.name: MediaVolumeUp
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Media Volume Up

variant.name: MoveBackwardOneCharOfText
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Move Backward One Char Of Text

variant.name: MoveBackwardOneWordOfText
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Move Backward One Word Of Text

variant.name: MoveCursor
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Move Cursor

variant.name: MoveDownOneLineOfText
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Move Down One Line Of Text

variant.name: MoveForwardOneCharOfText
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Move Forward One Char Of Text

variant.name: MoveForwardOneWordOfText
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Move Forward One Word Of Text

variant.name: MoveUpOneLineOfText
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Move Up One Line Of Text

variant.name: Paste
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Paste

variant.name: PointScan
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Point Scan

variant.name: RightClick
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Right Click

variant.name: ScrollDown
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Scroll Down

variant.name: ScrollLeft
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Scroll Left

variant.name: ScrollRight
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Scroll Right

variant.name: ScrollUp
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Scroll Up

variant.name: Select
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Select

variant.name: Settings
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Settings

variant.name: Shortcuts
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Shortcuts

variant.name: StartRecording
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Start Recording

variant.name: StartTextSelection
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Start Text Selection

variant.name: StopRecording
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Stop Recording

variant.name: SystemDiagnostics
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: System Diagnostics

variant.name: SystemHelp
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: System Help

variant.name: SystemLauncher
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: System Launcher

variant.name: SystemMenu
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: System Menu

variant.name: SystemScreenshot
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: System Screenshot

variant.name: SystemStatusBar
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: System Status Bar

variant.name: SystemTaskManager
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: System Task Manager

variant.name: UserLock
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: User Lock

variant.name: UserMenu
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: User Menu

variant.name: UserNextUser
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: User Next User

variant.name: UserPreviousUser
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: User Previous User

variant.name: UserSignOut
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: User Sign Out

variant.name: WebBookmark
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Web Bookmark

variant.name: WebBottomOfPage
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Web Bottom Of Page

variant.name: WebClearHistory
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Web Clear History

variant.name: WebDownloads
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Web Downloads

variant.name: WebFindInPage
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Web Find In Page

variant.name: WebMenu
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Web Menu

variant.name: WebTopOfPage
variant.summary: Switch Access Menu Action: Web Top Of Page

histogram.name: Accessibility.ActiveTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time accessibility was enabled and actively used. Reported when we switch states from active to inactive.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Android.Cache.MaxNodesInCache
histogram.summary: Tracks the maximum number of AccessibilityNodeInfo objects that were stored in the Java-side cache during a single session.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Android.Cache.PercentageRetrievedFromCache
histogram.summary: Tracks the percentage of calls from the Android framework to create a new AccessibilityNodeInfo object that were serviced from the cache rather than constructing the object from scratch during a single session.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Android.OnDemand.EventsDropped
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of AccessibilityEvents dropped when the OnDemand accessibility services feature is enabled. Recorded at the end of a session.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Android.OnDemand.OneHundredPercentEventsDropped
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of AccessibilityEvents dropped when the OnDemand accessibility services feature is enabled, and when the total percentage of dropped events is 100%. Recorded at the end of a session.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Android.OnDemand.OneHundredPercentEventsDropped.{AXMode}
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of AccessibilityEvents dropped when the OnDemand accessibility services feature is enabled, and the ComputeAXMode feature is enabled, and the number of events dropped is 100%. Tracks for when the AXMode is set to {AXMode}. Recorded a the end of a session.

variant.name: Basic
variant.summary: kAXModeBasic - Includes only NativeAPIs and WebContents

variant.name: Complete
variant.summary: kAXModeComplete - Includes NativeAPIs, WebContents, InlineTextBoxes, ScreenReader, and HTML

histogram.name: Accessibility.Android.OnDemand.PercentageDropped
histogram.summary: Tracks the percentage of AccessibilityEvents dropped when the OnDemand accessibility services feature is enabled. Recorded at the end of a session.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Android.OnDemand.PercentageDropped.{AXMode}
histogram.summary: Tracks the percentage of AccessibilityEvents dropped when the OnDemand accessibility services feature is enabled, and the ComputeAXMode feature is enabled. Tracks for when the AXMode is set to {AXMode}. Recorded at the end of a session.

variant.name: Basic
variant.summary: kAXModeBasic - Includes only NativeAPIs and WebContents

variant.name: Complete
variant.summary: kAXModeComplete - Includes NativeAPIs, WebContents, InlineTextBoxes, ScreenReader, and HTML

histogram.name: Accessibility.Android.ScreenReader{AccessibilityEveryReport}
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a screen reader is enabled on Android (e.g. Talkback). This is checked once, 45 seconds after startup. Note: prefer Accessibility.Android.ScreenReader.EveryReport when querying for unique users, as it is logged more frequently. {AccessibilityEveryReport}

histogram.name: Accessibility.Android.TabSwitcherPreferenceEnabled
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the accessibility tab switcher is enabled when an accessibility service (e.g. TalkBack or Switch Access) is enabled that would typically cause the accessibility tab switcher to be used. Recorded when the activity is resumed or accessibility services are turned on.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Android.UserFontSizePref.Change
histogram.summary: Records the current user font size pref when exiting accessibility settings if the preference was changed. The font size ranges from 50% to 200% and can be set in increments of 5%; the default is 100%.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Android.UserFontSizePref.OnStartup
histogram.summary: Records the current user font size pref during deferred startup for ChromeActivity. The font size ranges from 50% to 200% and can be set in increments of 5%; the default is 100%.

histogram.name: Accessibility.AndroidServiceInfo
histogram.summary: Deprecated as of 10/2022, M109. Now using the per-variant enum (below). Tracks flags and capabilities of enabled accessibility services. Recorded every time an Android web content view first creates a virtual view hierarchy, indicating that some accessibility service is running. The number of emits of this histogram won't be as useful as the unique user counts. The primary purpose of this is to guide optimization by determining what capabilities of accessibility services are widespread and which ones are relatively rare.

histogram.name: Accessibility.AndroidServiceInfo.{RunningApps}
histogram.summary: Tracks events, flags, feedback and capabilities of enabled accessibility services separated into variants based on the types of running accessibility services. This information would be a subset of the (now deprecated) Accessibility.AndroidServiceInfo histogram. It will allow us to look at the same histograms but only for a subset of users (e.g. what are the requested flags etc of enabled accessibility services for clients running only a password manager).

histogram.name: Accessibility.ATK-APIs
histogram.summary: Tracks usage of ATK APIs on Linux Desktop. Recorded when ATK APIs that are supposed to trigger AX mode enabled is called.

histogram.name: Accessibility.AutoDisabled.DisabledTime
histogram.summary: The total amount of time accessibility was disabled due to being auto-disabled, before being enabled again.

histogram.name: Accessibility.AutoDisabled.EnabledTime
histogram.summary: The total amount of time accessibility was enabled before being auto-disabled.

histogram.name: Accessibility.AutoDisabled.EventCount
histogram.summary: The number of user input events that were received within one time window, without any accompanying accessibility API usage, that triggered accessibility to be auto-disabled.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CaptionSettingsLoadedFromPrefs
histogram.summary: Whether custom caption settings were loaded from the user preferences. Recorded when WebKit preferences are overridden.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CaptionSettingsLoadedFromSystemSettings
histogram.summary: Whether custom caption settings were loaded from the system preferences. Recorded when WebKit preferences are overridden.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ChromeVox.PerformGestureType
histogram.summary: A user can control ChromeVox via a variety of gestures on the touch screen. For example, swiping right with one finger causes ChromeVox to navigate to the next object. Track all possible gestures here.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosAlwaysShowA11yMenu
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Accessibility Menu is set to be shown regardless of the state of a11y features.(logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosAutoclick
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Autoclick feature is on (logged once 45 secs after startup). Warning: this histogram was expired 2021-12-31 to 2022-07-07, data might be missing.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosAutoclick.TrayMenu.ChangeAction
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user has picked a new autoclick action type from the bubble menu.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosCaretHighlight
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS caret highlighting is on (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosCursorColor
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS feature to colorize the cursor is enabled (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosCursorHighlight
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS cursor highlighting is on (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosDictation
histogram.summary: Whether the ChromeOS dictation feature is enabled (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosDictation.Language
histogram.summary: The language used for speech recognition in dictation on ChromeOS. This is logged each time Dictation is toggled on. From M99 to M104 this was logged using base::PersistantHash instead of base::HashMetricName; data from that period can be decoded using a map between the two hashing functions. See crbug.com/1342966.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosDictation.ListeningDuration.NetworkRecognition
histogram.summary: Duration that the network speech recognition service was listening for dictation. Recorded each time a user toggles dictation on until dictation is stopped, either by the user action, error, or timeout.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosDictation.ListeningDuration.OnDeviceRecognition
histogram.summary: Duration that the on-device speech recognition service was listening for dictation. Recorded each time a user toggles dictation on until dictation is stopped, either by the user action, error, or timeout.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosDictation.MacroFailed
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever Dictation fails to perform a macro.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosDictation.MacroRecognized
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever Dictation recognizes a macro.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosDictation.MacroSucceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever Dictation successfully performs a macro.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosDictation.ToggleDictationMethod
histogram.summary: Records how users invoke Dictation.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosDictation.UsedOnDeviceSpeech
histogram.summary: When Dictation was toggled on, records whether on-device speech recognition was used. If on-device recognition was not used, network speech was used.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosDockedMagnifier
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Docked Magnifier feature is on (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosFocusHighlight
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS focus highlighting is on (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosHighContrast
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS High Contrast mode feature is on (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosLargeCursor
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Large Cursor feature is on (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosLargeCursorSize
histogram.summary: Cursor size of the Chrome OS Large Cursor (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosScreenMagnifier
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Screen Magnifier feature is on (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS select-to-speak is on (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.BackgroundShading
histogram.summary: Whether Select-to-Speak had background shading enabled when activated.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.BubbleDismissMethod
histogram.summary: When Select-to-speak is active, the user can dismiss the bubble menu in multiple ways: by clicking the cancel button on the Select-to-speak menu or using keyboard shortcuts. Track the methods here.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.EnhancedNetworkVoices
histogram.summary: Whether enhanced network TTS voices were enabled when Select-to-Speak was activated.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.NavigationControls
histogram.summary: Whether Select-to-Speak's navigation controls were on when activated.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.OverrideSpeechRateMultiplier
histogram.summary: The multiplier with which the user overrode the speech rate setting in Select-to-Speak. By default, the global Text-to-Speech setting is used, which the user can temporarily override. The override multiplier is stored as a sparse histogram with values (100 * multiple). For example, a speech rate multiplier of 1.0 (default) will be seen as 100. Emitted once every time playback starts, including on resume after pause or change of selection.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.ParagraphNavigationMethod
histogram.summary: When Select-to-speak is active, the user can navigate between paragraphs in multiple ways: by clicking the navigation buttons on the Select-to-speak menu or using keyboard shortcuts. Track the methods here.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.SentenceNavigationMethod
histogram.summary: When Select-to-speak is active, the user can navigate between sentences in multiple ways: by clicking the navigation buttons on the Select-to-speak menu or using keyboard shortcuts. Track the methods here.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.StartSpeechMethod
histogram.summary: A user may activate Select-to-Speak by holding down 'search' and clicking or dragging a region with the mouse, or by highlighting an area and using search + s to read just the highlighted area. Track the methods here.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.StateChangeEvent
histogram.summary: A user has tapped a button in the tray to change Select-to-Speak's state. The tap was interpreted by Select-to-Speak as a request to start selection, to cancel speech, or to cancel selection, depending on Select-to-Speak's internal state when the tap occured. This tracks when the button was tapped and the event that it generated.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.TtsEngineUsed
histogram.summary: Which TTS engine was used for making TTS requests from Select-to-speak. This is recorded every time a new speech request is made in Select-to-speak. Note that this is only recorded on the start of speech, so it is not recorded, for example, when the user resumes speech after pausing it.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosShelfNavigationButtonsInTabletModeChanged.OOBE
histogram.summary: The value for shelf navigation buttons setting set by the user during OOBE. The metric will be reported after the setting has been stable for 10 seconds, or the OOBE screen in which the value can be set is closed (if the setting changes multiple times in quick succession, only the final value will be reported).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosShelfNavigationButtonsInTabletModeChanged.OsSettings
histogram.summary: The value for shelf navigation buttons setting set by the user in Chrome OS Settings page. The metric will be reported after the setting change has been stable for 10 seconds, or the settings window in which the value is set gets closed (if the setting changes multiple times in quick succession, only the final value will be reported).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSpokenFeedback{AccessibilityEveryReport}
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Spoken Feedback feature is on (logged once 45 secs after startup). Note: prefer Accessibility.CrosSpokenFeedback.EveryReport when querying for unique users, as it is logged more frequently. {AccessibilityEveryReport}

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosStickyKeys
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Sticky Keys feature is on (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSwitchAccess
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS switch access is on (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSwitchAccess.AutoScan
histogram.summary: The value of the Switch Access "Auto Scan" setting, logged immediately after toggling. This will show us how often users are turning the feature on, and how often they are turning it back off again.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSwitchAccess.AutoScan.KeyboardSpeedMs
histogram.summary: Measures the user-set speed for scanning between keyboard keys in Switch Access, logged immediately after changing the setting. Values range from 1ms to 10000ms, in 100ms buckets.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSwitchAccess.AutoScan.SpeedMs
histogram.summary: Measures the user-set speed for auto scanning between items in Switch Access, logged immediately after changing the setting. Values range from 1ms to 10000ms, in 100ms buckets.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSwitchAccess.Error
histogram.summary: Switch Access error occurred. See CrosSwitchAccessError enum for error types.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSwitchAccess.NextKeyCode
histogram.summary: Which key code user has assigned to the Next Action (e.g. 32 for the Space key)

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSwitchAccess.PreviousKeyCode
histogram.summary: Which key code user has assigned to the Previous Action (e.g. 32 for the Space key)

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSwitchAccess.SelectKeyCode
histogram.summary: Which key code user has assigned to the Select Action (e.g. 32 for the Space key)

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosVirtualKeyboard
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Virtual Keyboard feature is on (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.FocusHighlight.ToggleEnabled
histogram.summary: The value of the "show a quick focus highlight" setting, logged immediately after toggling. This will show us how often users are turning the feature on, and how often they are turning it back off again.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ImageLabels
histogram.obsolete: Logged on profile open, including for profiles that do not show web content. (For those profiles, this logged the value of disabled.) Replaced in M-107 with Accessibility.ImageLabels2, which is similar but not logged for unnecessary profiles.
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome accessibility image label setting is on. Logged once 45 secs after profile open.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ImageLabels.Android
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome accessibility image label setting is on for Android. Logged once 45 secs after profile open, which always happens when the browser starts.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ImageLabels.Android.DialogOption
histogram.summary: When a user opens the accessibility image label dialog on Android, records what option they select on user interaction.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ImageLabels.Android.OnlyOnWifi
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome accessibility image label setting for Android is set to only be enabled on a Wi-Fi connection. Logged once 45 secs after profile open, which always happens when the browser starts.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ImageLabels.ModalDialogAccepted
histogram.summary: Whether a user accepts or does not accept a modal dialog enabling the image labels option. If the user does not accept it this does not track whether they closed it with the negative button, the close button, or keyboard escape.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ImageLabels.PageLanguage
histogram.summary: The language of a web page where image labels were requested, as detected by Chrome (not necessarily what language the page claims to be in).

histogram.name: Accessibility.ImageLabels.RequestLanguage
histogram.summary: The language that was requested for image descriptions, based on the page language, the user's accept languages and top languages, and the server languages.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ImageLabels.{Result}By{Dimension}
histogram.summary: Counts the number of images that got a certain result from automatic image labeling (empty, error, or success), as a function of the function of one of the image's dimensions - either the min or the max dimension.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ImageLabels.{Result}By{Length}
histogram.summary: Counts the number of images that got a certain result from automatic image labeling (empty, error, or success), as a function of the function of the length of the characters in the image's name - either the original name, or the name after removing stopwords.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ImageLabels2
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome accessibility image label setting is on. Logged once 45 secs after profile open. Only logged for regular profiles, Incognito profiles, and guest off-the-record profiles, as these are the only profiles that can display web content.

histogram.name: Accessibility.InactiveTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time accessibility was enabled but not actively used. Reported when we switch states from inactive to active. This histogram will not be logged if the auto-disable accessibility feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Accessibility.iOS.NewLargerTextCategory
histogram.summary: This metric is related to the Preferred Content Size chosen by the user. It is only recorded once per session. This is hit if the chosen category is not listed in the map defined in /ios/chrome/browser/ui/util/dynamic_type_util.mm. In that case, we should update the code by adding an entry for the new category in that map. This is logged when the helper to returning the multiplier associated with the current preferred content size is called.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LanguageDetection.CountDetectionAttempted
histogram.summary: The number of nodes on this page for which language detection was attempted.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LanguageDetection.CountLabelled
histogram.summary: The number of nodes on this page for which a detected language was successfully assigned.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LanguageDetection.LangsPerPage
histogram.summary: The number of unique languages which were detected to be the most probable language for at least one node on the page, regardless of whether a detected language was assigned for that node.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LanguageDetection.PercentageLabelledWithTop
histogram.summary: Of the nodes which had a detected language assigned, the percentage for which the assigned language was the language detected as having the highest probability.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LanguageDetection.PercentageLanguageDetected
histogram.summary: Of the nodes for which language detection was attempted, the percentage for which a language was successfully assigned.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LanguageDetection.PercentageOverridden
histogram.summary: Of the nodes for which a detected language was successfully assigned, the percentage where the assigned language differs from the author-provided language.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption
histogram.summary: Whether the Live Caption feature is enabled. This is logged once, 45 seconds after startup.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.AudioPropertyChanged
histogram.summary: Whether the sample rate or channel count of a Live Caption audio stream changed midstream. This is logged once per audio stream on the destruction of the Cloud speech recognition client.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.CaptionBubbleError
histogram.summary: Records when the caption bubble displays an error. This is logged once each time the caption bubble model encounters an error.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.Duration.CaptionBubble{Visibility}2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 09/2022. Now using Accessibility.LiveCaption.Duration.CaptionBubble{Visibility}3 This metric measured the total speech recognition time not only for Live Caption but also for other applications that use SODA.
histogram.summary: Measures how long SODA was running while the Live Caption UI was {Visibility}. Logged once on the destruction of the SpeechRecognitionRecognizerImpl.

variant.name: Hidden
variant.summary: hidden. This might be because it was closed by user or because there was an error passing transcriptions to the UI

variant.name: Visible
variant.summary: visible and showing transcriptions

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.Duration.CaptionBubble{Visibility}3
histogram.summary: Measures how long SODA was running while the Live Caption UI was {Visibility}. Logged once on the destruction of the SpeechRecognitionRecognizerImpl.

variant.name: Hidden
variant.summary: hidden. This might be because it was closed by user or because there was an error passing transcriptions to the UI

variant.name: Visible
variant.summary: visible and showing transcriptions

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.EnableFrom{Entrypoint}
histogram.summary: Records when a user enables or disables the Live Caption feature from {Entrypoint}.

variant.name: GlobalMediaControls
variant.summary: global media controls (Zenith)

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.ExpandBubble
histogram.summary: Records when a user expands or collapses the Live Caption bubble.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.FeatureEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether the Live Caption feature flag is enabled. This is logged once at the time of component registration.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.LiveCaptionPinBubbleEvent
histogram.summary: Records when a user pins or unpins the Live Caption bubble.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.LoadSodaErrorCode
histogram.summary: The error code of a failed attempt to load the Speech On-Device API (SODA) binary. This is logged once for each media stream if the SODA binary failed to load on Windows.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.LoadSodaResult
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to load the Speech On-Device API (SODA) binary. This is logged once for each media stream when the SODA binary is loaded.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.Session2
histogram.summary: Logged when the Live Caption bubble appears and disappears. Stream start indicates when the bubble appears due to an audio session starting. Stream end indicates when the bubble disappears due to a tab change, a navigation, or the audio session ending and the bubble fading out due to inactivity. Close button clicked indicates when the bubble disappears due to a user clicking the close button on the caption bubble.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.SodaVerificationFailureMissingIndicatorFile
histogram.summary: Whether the verification of the Speech On-Device API (SODA) component failed due to a mismatch of the component architecture. Logged once during the verification step of the SODA component installation on Windows only.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaption.SpeechRecognitionServiceLanguage
histogram.summary: The language code used to initialize the speech recognition service. Logged once when getting the Speech On-Device API (SODA) config path to use with the speech recognition service.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Mac.ScreenReader{AccessibilityEveryReport}
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a screen reader is enabled on Mac (e.g. VoiceOver). This is logged once, 45 seconds after startup. Note: prefer Accessibility.Mac.ScreenReader.EveryReport when querying for unique users, as it is logged more frequently. {AccessibilityEveryReport}

histogram.name: Accessibility.ManuallyEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome has enabled accessibility support because the user passed the --force-renderer-accessibility flag on the command-line (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.ModeFlag
histogram.summary: Whether individual accessibility mode flags are set. Tracked when each mode flag is flipped from false to true. These flags are flipped automatically when software communicates with Chrome via accessibility APIs. Flags can only be flipped off by advanced users or for debugging using chrome://accessibility/ - and that isn't tracked in this histogram.

histogram.name: Accessibility.OOBEStartupSoundDelay
histogram.summary: Delay between login_prompt_visible and Chrome OS OOBE startup sound playback. Depends on sound subsystem initialization time.

histogram.name: Accessibility.PDF.HasAccessibleText
histogram.summary: When a PDF is constructed for accessibility, true if any page of the PDF contains any accessible text derived from a text run. Note that a PDF containing a mix of images and text will record true even though the images may themselves contain inaccessible text.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Performance.BrowserAccessibilityManager::OnAccessibilityEvents
histogram.summary:
Tracks time spent on the browser main thread handling accessibility events sent from the renderer process and processed by BrowserAccessibilityManager.
Accessibility.Performance.HandleAXEvents can still often record values when processing is relatively cheap because we exit before handing off the nodes to BrowserAccessibilityManager for various reasons (e.g. BFCache). This histogram only measures events which are processed by BrowserAccessibilityManager and thus should have a better histogram to understand the cost of doing so, and be used to meaure optimizations.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Performance.HandleAXEvents
histogram.summary: Tracks time spent on the browser main thread handling accessibility events sent from the renderer process. Logged each time the method is run without returning early.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Performance.ProcessDeferredAccessibilityEvents
histogram.summary: Tracks time spent on the render process processing deferred accessibility events. Logged each time the method is run during the accessbility document lifecycle.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Performance.SendPendingAccessibilityEvents
histogram.summary: Tracks time spent on the render process sending pending accessibility events. Logged each time the method is run without returning early.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Performance.Tree.Unserialize
histogram.summary: Tracks time spent on the browser process unserializing accessibility updates. Logged each time the method is run without returning early.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Performance.WinAPIs.{API}
histogram.summary:
Tracks time taken to execute the public Windows API that {API}. This is recorded for all Windows users that call into our public APIs.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

variant.name: UMA_API_ELEMENT_PROVIDER_FROM_POINT
variant.summary: finds a node given a point.

variant.name: UMA_API_GET_BOUNDINGRECTANGLE
variant.summary: gets the bounding rectangle of a node.

variant.name: UMA_API_GET_PATTERN_PROVIDER
variant.summary: retrieves an object that provides support for the given control pattern.

variant.name: UMA_API_GET_PROPERTY_VALUE
variant.summary: gets the value of the specified property.

variant.name: UMA_API_NAVIGATE
variant.summary: navigates by one node in the given direction.

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXT_RANGEFROMPOINT
variant.summary: gets the text range under the given point.

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_COMPARE
variant.summary: compares two text ranges

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_COMPAREENDPOINTS
variant.summary: compares two endpoints

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_EXPANDTOENCLOSINGUNIT
variant.summary: expands or contracts the text range to given unit.

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_FINDATTRIBUTE
variant.summary: searches for an attribute within text range.

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_FINDTEXT
variant.summary: searches for given text within the text range.

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_GETATTRIBUTEVALUE
variant.summary: gets the value of the given attribute.

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_GETBOUNDINGRECTANGLES
variant.summary: gets the bounding rectanges of a text range.

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_GETCHILDREN
variant.summary: gets all children within a text range.

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_GETENCLOSINGELEMENT
variant.summary: gets the element that encloses the text range.

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_GETTEXT
variant.summary: gets the text within a text range.

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_MOVE
variant.summary: moves the text range by the given amount.

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_MOVEENDPOINTBYUNIT
variant.summary: moves endpoint by the given unit.

variant.name: UMA_API_TEXTRANGE_MOVEENPOINTBYRANGE
variant.summary: moves endpoint by the given range.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Reliability.Tree.UnserializeError
histogram.summary: Tracks the type of failure that occured when unserializing the accessibility tree. When an error in unserialization occurs, this is emitted and unserialization aborts. In the case of a tree with multiple issues, only the first error is recorded. Refer to AXTree::Unserialize for details.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Shortcuts.CrosDockedMagnifier
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Docked Magnifier shortcut is enabled. It's being emitted when the Docked Magnifier shortcut is triggered.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Shortcuts.CrosHighContrast
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS High Contrast mode shortcut is enabled. It's being emitted when the High Contrast shortcut is triggered.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Shortcuts.CrosScreenMagnifier
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Full-screen Magnifier mode shortcut is enabled. It's being emitted when the Full-screen Magnifier shortcut is triggered.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Shortcuts.CrosSpokenFeedback
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Spoken Feedback shortcut is enabled. It's being emitted when the Spoken Feedback shortcut is triggered.

histogram.name: Accessibility.VTTContainsStyleBlock
histogram.summary: Whether a VTT file contains an embedded style block. Recorded when a VTT file is parsed.

histogram.name: Accessibility.WebSpeech.Duration
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of a call to the WebSpeech API. Recorded once per call to the Open Speech API that powers the WebSpeech API.

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinAPIs
histogram.summary: Tracks usage of all public Windows accessibility APIs.

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinAPIs.GetPropertyValue
histogram.summary: Tracks properties requested via UI Automation GetPropertyValue().

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinHighContrastTheme
histogram.summary: Tracks which Windows high contrast theme is set in system settings (logged once 45 secs after startup). AccessibilityHighContrastColorScheme::None indicates that high contrast mode is not enabled.

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinJAWS{AccessibilityEveryReport}
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party JAWS screen reader is running (logged once 45 secs after startup). Note: prefer Accessibility.WinJAWS.EveryReport when querying for unique users, as it is logged more frequently. {AccessibilityEveryReport}

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinNVDA{AccessibilityEveryReport}
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party NVDA screen reader is running (logged once 45 secs after startup). Note: prefer Accessibility.WinNVDA.EveryReport when querying for unique users, as it is logged more frequently. {AccessibilityEveryReport}

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinScreenReader2{AccessibilityEveryReport}
histogram.summary: Whether the accessibility mode flag shows that a screen reader is running (logged once 45 secs after startup). In this case, Chrome has detected accessibility calls that would normally only occur from a screen reader. See also the more specific metrics such as Accessibility.WinJAWS/WinNVDA. Note: prefer Accessibility.WinScreenReader2.EveryReport when querying for unique users, as it is logged more frequently. {AccessibilityEveryReport}

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinStickyKeys
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that Sticky Keys are enabled.

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinSupernova{AccessibilityEveryReport}
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party Supernova screen reader is running (logged once 45 secs after startup). Note: prefer Accessibility.Supernova.EveryReport when querying for unique users, as it is logged more frequently. {AccessibilityEveryReport}

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinZoomText{AccessibilityEveryReport}
DomDistiller.DistillabilityRejection
histogram.summary: The reason to reject distillability at PageDistillableAfterParsing time.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.DistillabilityScoreNMF.Negative
histogram.summary: Score of distillability from AdaBoost model, non-mobile-friendly only. The score shown here is multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.DistillabilityScoreNMF.Positive
histogram.summary: Score of distillability from AdaBoost model, non-mobile-friendly only. The score shown here is multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.InfoBarUsage
histogram.summary: "Used" is recorded when the user clicks the infobar to enter Reader Mode. "Not Used" is recorded when the user clicks the close button. If there's no user action, nothing is recorded.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.LongArticleScoreNMF.Negative
histogram.summary: Score of long article from AdaBoost model, distillable and non-mobile-friendly only. The score shown here is multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.LongArticleScoreNMF.Positive
histogram.summary: Score of long article from AdaBoost model, distillable and non-mobile-friendly only. The score shown here is multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.MessageDismissalCondition
histogram.summary: Records whether the user accepted or ignored/dismissed the Reader Mode message prompt in conjunction with the Reader Mode accessibility setting. Recorded for Android only.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.PageDistillableAfterLoading
histogram.summary: Records the "Distillable Type" (mobile-friendly not distillable, mobile-friendly distillable, non-mobile-friendly not distillable, non-mobile-friendly distillable) for each analyzed page after loading.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.PageDistillableAfterParsing
histogram.summary: Records the "Distillable Type" (mobile-friendly not distillable, mobile-friendly distillable, non-mobile-friendly not distillable, non-mobile-friendly distillable) for each analyzed page after parsing.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.PageHasDistilledData
histogram.summary: Records whether a page has distilled data.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.ReaderMode.EntryPoint
histogram.summary: The method a user used to enter reader mode on an article.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.ReaderMode.ExitPoint
histogram.summary: The method a user used to exit reader mode and return to the original article.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.ReaderModeAccessibilitySettingSelected
histogram.summary: Records when the Reader Mode accessibility setting is selected or deselected. Recorded for Android only.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.ReaderShownForPageLoad
histogram.summary: Records if the panel became visible at any point after a page was navigated.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Statistics.FirstPageWordCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of words in a distilled page. This only records the first page of a multi-page article.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Statistics.WordCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of words in a distilled page. For articles with multiple pages, each page is counted separately.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.ActivelyViewingArticleBeforeDistilling
histogram.summary: Records the amount of active time a user spent on a distillable page before switching that page to Reader Mode. Active time is time that the article was visible, not total time the page was open: the timer is paused when the page is not visible. This is not recorded when the user opens a distillable page but does not switch to Reader Mode from that page (via the omnibox icon or menu option).

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.ActivelyViewingReaderModePage
histogram.summary: Records the amount of active time a user spent on a Reader Mode page. Active time is the time the Reader Mode page was visible, not the total time the page was open: the timer is paused when the page is not visible. This is recorded regardless of how a user enters the page: e.g. using the forward/back buttons, entering the URL directly, or coming from a distillable page all start the timer equally.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.ArticleProcessing
histogram.summary: Time spent in DomDistiller's identification of text content.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.DistillationTotal
histogram.summary: Complete time spent in DomDistiller's processing of a page.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.DistillPage
histogram.summary: Time spent in DistillPageImpl(), mostly ExecuteJavaScript(), including compilation and execution.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.DocumentConstruction
histogram.summary: Time spent in creating DomDistiller's internal representation of the HTML document.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.Formatting
histogram.summary: Time spent in DomDistiller's final processing of article content/formatting.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.MarkupParsing
histogram.summary: Time spent in DomDistiller's processing of article metadata.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.RunJavaScript
histogram.summary: Time spent in ExecuteJavaScript() in DomDistiller. It includes JavaScript code transmission through IPC, parsing, compilation, execution, and returning the JSON back through IPC.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.ViewerLoading
histogram.summary: Records the time from the Reader Mode panel opening to the viewer loaded.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.ViewingReaderModePage
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a user spent on a Reader Mode Page.

histogram.name: PumpkinInstaller.InstallationSuccess
histogram.summary: Pumpkin installation is triggered when one of the features using Pumpkin (currently the only feature using Pumpkin is Dictation) are enabled. This histogram is recorded once when Pumpkin installation finishes with either success or failure.

histogram.name: SodaInstaller.BinaryInstallationFailureTime
histogram.summary: Soda Installation is triggered when one of the features using SODA (e.g. Live Caption, Projector, Offline Dictation) are enabled. Records the time taken to get to SODA binary installation error. This is recorded once when SODA installation attempt fails.

histogram.name: SodaInstaller.BinaryInstallationResult
histogram.summary: Soda Installation is triggered when one of the features using SODA (e.g. Live Caption, Projector, Offline Dictation) are enabled. Records whether SODA binary installation succeeded. This is recorded once when SODA installation attempt finishes with either success or failure.

histogram.name: SodaInstaller.BinaryInstallationSuccessTime
histogram.summary: Soda Installation is triggered when one of the features using SODA (e.g. Live Caption, Projector, Offline Dictation) are enabled. Records the time taken to successfully install SODA binary. This is recorded once when SODA installation attempt succeedes.

histogram.name: SodaInstaller.Language.{SodaLanguageCode}.InstallationFailureTime
histogram.summary: Soda Installation is triggered when one of the features using SODA (e.g. Live Caption, Projector, Offline Dictation) are enabled. Records the time taken to get to SODA language pack installation error. This is recorded once when SODA language pack installation attempt fails.

histogram.name: SodaInstaller.Language.{SodaLanguageCode}.InstallationResult
histogram.summary: Soda Installation is triggered when one of the features using SODA (e.g. Live Caption, Projector, Offline Dictation) are enabled. Records whether SODA language pack installation succeeded or not. This is recorded once when SODA language pack installation attempt finishes with either success or failure.

histogram.name: SodaInstaller.Language.{SodaLanguageCode}.InstallationSuccessTime
histogram.summary: Soda Installation is triggered when one of the features using SODA (e.g. Live Caption, Projector, Offline Dictation) are enabled. Records the time taken to successfully install SODA language pack. This is recorded once when SODA language pack installation succeedes.

histogram.name: TextToSpeech.Event
histogram.summary: Events fired by the text-to-speech engine when speaking an utterance.

histogram.name: TextToSpeech.Utterance.FromExtensionAPI
histogram.summary: Indicates if an utterance spoken via synthesized text-to-speech was triggered by the Chrome TTS extension API or the web speech API.

histogram.name: TextToSpeech.Utterance.HasVoiceName
histogram.summary: True if an utterance spoken via synthesized text-to-speech requested a specific voice by name.

histogram.name: TextToSpeech.Utterance.Native
histogram.summary: True if an utterance is spoken with native speech provided by the operating system, otherwise it's spoken via a Chrome extension that implements text-to-speech support.

histogram.name: TextToSpeech.Utterance.Source
histogram.summary: ChromeOS source that triggered text-to-speech utterance via extension API, from a few known accessibility clients (Select-to-speak, ChromeVox).

histogram.name: TextToSpeech.Utterance.TextLength
histogram.summary: The length of an utterance to be spoken via synthesized text-to-speech.
